column1: 1A70013D-FEDA-4937-8D79-D221C07335EA#appfire#8CE810CA-3609-440B-92A0-E7C1580F08F6#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-21 11:52:15.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-21 11:52:15.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#8A8F8337-5C30-47E2-AAA8-902469DD0408#appfire#8CE810CA-3609-440B-92A0-E7C1580F08F6#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-21 11:52:15.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-21 11:52:15.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#E28780F0-4B9E-4DA2-9870-6335C3FF09B5#appfire#8CE810CA-3609-440B-92A0-E7C1580F08F6#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-21 11:52:15.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-21 11:52:15.0#appfire#1
